channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Gangs use sexual violence to control communities in Haiti
item.description: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.content:encoded: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.
item.content:encoded:
Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

(Image credit: Ella Carmen Dale)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: How the U.S. has changed its approach to foreign aid this year
item.description: This year saw the dismantling of USAID, the United States' premier aid agency. What was the impact and what does the future of U.S. foreign aid look like in the health realm?
item.content:encoded: This year saw the dismantling of USAID, the United States' premier aid agency. What was the impact and what does the future of U.S. foreign aid look like in the health realm?
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Myanmar is holding its first elections in five years
item.description: Myanmar's is holding its first elections since the military seized power five years ago. It could give the military junta more legitimacy.
item.content:encoded: Myanmar's is holding its first elections since the military seized power five years ago. It could give the military junta more legitimacy.
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: Russia attacks Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-U.S. talks
item.description: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Myanmar is set to hold phased elections. Here's why they're being called a 'sham'
item.description: Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.
item.content:encoded:
Myanmar's military rulers are holding a general election in phases starting Dec. 28 amid the country's civil war. The head of the U.N. says the vote will be anything but free and fair.

(Image credit: Aung Shine Oo)
item.dc:creator: Michael Sullivan

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire agreement to end border fighting
item.description: In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.
item.content:encoded:
In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The latest on the nuclear sub deal between the U.S. and South Korea
item.description: The U.S. will shift some of the burden of defense to its allies, and it will equip them for it. One ally's equipment: nuclear submarines for South Korea.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. will shift some of the burden of defense to its allies, and it will equip them for it. One ally's equipment: nuclear submarines for South Korea.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: What happened to U.S. foreign aid this year?
item.description: Historically, the U.S. had been the top donor for global health. That changed dramatically this year. We look at the new approach the U.S. is pursuing and what this has meant for people on the ground.
item.content:encoded: Historically, the U.S. had been the top donor for global health. That changed dramatically this year. We look at the new approach the U.S. is pursuing and what this has meant for people on the ground.
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: U.S. strikes alleged Islamic State camps in Nigeria
item.description: President Trump ordered U.S. strikes on ISIS targets in northwest Nigeria, in response to what he claimed is persecution of Christians
item.content:encoded: President Trump ordered U.S. strikes on ISIS targets in northwest Nigeria, in response to what he claimed is persecution of Christians
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu
